intro: Buddleja brasiliensis subsp. stachyoides, commonly known as the Brazilian butterfly bush, is a shrub native to South America. It is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. The flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including butterflies and bees, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
